intro: Hieracium tephrodes subsp. cinerosiforme, commonly known as the ash-gray hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, grayish-green leaves and yellow flowers arranged in a composite head. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. It has a creeping rootstock and produces numerous flowering stems. Its flowers are pollinated by insects, and it is often found in association with other herbaceous plants in its native environment.
